name: Three-Quarters Cover
description: A target has Three-Quarters Cover when it is behind an object that covers at least three-quarters of the target. Three-Quarters Cover grants a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. A target can benefit from cover only when an attack or other effect originates on the opposite side of the cover. If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies; the degrees aren't added together. For example, if a target is behind a creature that gives Half Cover and a tree trunk that gives Three-Quarters Cover, the target has Three-Quarters Cover.
shortDescription: An object covering at least three-quarters of a target grants +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.
rulesAsWritten: Three-Quarters Cover: +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. Offered by an object that covers at least three-quarters of the target. A target can benefit from cover only when an attack or other effect originates on the opposite side of the cover. If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies; the degrees aren't added together.

applicationLogic.name: Three-Quarters Cover Defensive Bonus
applicationLogic.description: When a target is behind an object that covers at least three-quarters of the target, and an attack or other effect originates on the opposite side of the cover, the target gains a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.

removalConditions.description: Three-Quarters Cover ends when the target is no longer behind an object that covers at least three-quarters of its body, or when the attack or effect no longer originates from the opposite side of the cover.

stacking.stackingNote: If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies; the degrees aren't added together. For example, if a target is behind a creature that gives Half Cover and a tree trunk that gives Three-Quarters Cover, the target has Three-Quarters Cover.

dmNotes: Three-Quarters Cover is provided by objects such as thick tree trunks, portcullises, arrow slits, or similar obstacles that block at least three-quarters of the target. Unlike Half Cover, Three-Quarters Cover cannot be provided by another creature; it must be an object. The DM determines whether a given obstacle qualifies as Three-Quarters Cover based on how much of the target it conceals relative to the origin of the attack or effect.

commonRulings.question: Can another creature provide Three-Quarters Cover?
commonRulings.ruling: No. The rules specify that Three-Quarters Cover is offered by 'an object that covers at least three-quarters of the target.' Half Cover can be provided by another creature, but Three-Quarters Cover requires an object.

commonRulings.question: How does Three-Quarters Cover interact with Half Cover and Total Cover?
commonRulings.ruling: If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies. The degrees are not added together. If a target has both Half Cover and Three-Quarters Cover from different sources, only Three-Quarters Cover applies.

commonRulings.question: Does Three-Quarters Cover protect against all Dexterity saving throws?
commonRulings.ruling: Three-Quarters Cover grants a +5 bonus to Dexterity saving throws, but only when the effect that triggers the saving throw originates on the opposite side of the cover from the target.

commonRulings.question: Does Three-Quarters Cover affect spell targeting?
commonRulings.ruling: Three-Quarters Cover provides a +5 bonus to AC against attack rolls (including spell attack rolls) and +5 to Dexterity saving throws, but it does not prevent direct targeting. Only Total Cover prevents a target from being targeted directly by an attack or a spell.
